snippet: The country’s turmoil of the last four years has created an opportunity for the Islamic State as it comes under increasing pressure from airstrikes in Iraq and Syria.
abstract: Libya's internal battles over money and power during past four years have enabled Islamic State to claim parts of country as new frontier amid rising pressure from airstrikes in Iraq and Syria; two fighting coalitions of militias have split Libya and factions seem more bent on warring with each other than confronting ISIS.

byline.contributor: Suliman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Surt, and C. J. Chivers from New York.

lead_paragraph: The country’s turmoil of the last four years has created an opportunity for the Islamic State as it comes under increasing pressure from airstrikes in Iraq and Syria.

headline.main: ISIS Finds New Frontier in Chaotic Libya
headline.print_headline: Islamic State Finds New Frontier in Chaotic Libya

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
